intro: Oenanthe montis-khortiati, commonly known as the Karakoram water-dropwort, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Karakoram Mountains. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its leaves are compound, with finely divided lobes, and it produces small white to greenish flowers. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
